sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都可表示"愚蠢的，笨的，傻的"之意。
means: foolish ： 一般指人的无头脑、愚蠢，或缺乏常识与判断力，或指行动的愚蠢可笑。
silly ： 口语用词，可和foolish互换，但语气稍强。侧重指人的言行不合常规或不理智，强调单纯、低能和糊涂。
stupid ： 多指人或行为的愚蠢，尤指先天智能低下，或因某种原因失去正常的反应或感觉。有时也可与silly和foolish换用，但语气强，常含贬义。
simple ： 强调头脑简单或缺少智慧。
dull ： 指对问题理解迟钝，缺乏灵敏机智头脑，可能是先下智力低下，也可能因疲倦或健康不佳所致。

sentence.Network_en: Any action on the basis of such fragmentary evidence would be foolish.
sentence.Network_cn: 基于如此不完整的证据采取的任何行动都是愚蠢的。

sentence.Network_en: Making people feel foolish is emphatically not my strategy.
sentence.Network_cn: 让人出丑显然不是我的策略。

sentence.Network_en: I just stood there feeling foolish and watching him.
sentence.Network_cn: 我只是傻傻地站在那里看着他。

encyclopedia.content: 读音 foolish英音：['fu:liʃ]美音：['fulɪʃ] 词典解释 形容词 a. 1.愚蠢的，傻的[+to-v] a foolish person 愚蠢的人 How foolish I was not to have bought it. 我没买下它真是太傻。 It was foolish to take the test without preparation. 没有准备就去应试是愚蠢的。 2.荒谬的，可笑的 He looked foolish in his red pants. 他穿着红裤子看上去真可笑。 网络释义 1.愚蠢的；傻的；荒谬的 高中英语

entry.tran: (举止或行为)愚蠢的，傻的，笨的
entry.def: If someone's behaviour or action is foolish, it is not sensible and shows a lack of good judgment.

example.ex: It would be foolish to raise hopes unnecessarily...
example.tran: 无谓地燃起人们的希望是愚蠢的。

example.ex: It is foolish to risk skin cancer.
example.tran: 冒患上皮肤癌的风险是愚蠢的。

entry.def: If you look or feel foolish, you look or feel so silly or ridiculous that people are likely to laugh at you.

example.ex: I just stood there feeling foolish and watching him...
example.tran: 我只是傻傻地站在那里看着他。

example.ex: I didn't want him to look foolish and be laughed at.
example.tran: 我不希望见到他出丑，被别人嘲笑。

means.word_mean: 1. devoid of good sense or judgment;

sentences.sentence: "some fool idea about rewriting authors' books"

auth_sentence.content: One tired foolish statement wipes out weeks of work.

auth_sentence.content: The way some people justify their needs is foolish.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表形容词,"像……一样,有……的",通常放在具体的名词后; 2. 表动词,"造成……,成……"

churl粗野的人,吝啬鬼+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.脾气暴躁的
cold冷+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.微冷的
colt小马,无经验的年轻人+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.放浪不拘的,似小马的
fadd时尚+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.流行一时的,时尚的
fat非,胖+ish像……一样,有……的→fattish略胖的
fiend魔鬼+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.极凶恶的
fool愚人,白痴+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.愚笨的,愚蠢的
mode时尚+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.时髦的
self自己+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.自私的
snob势利的人,假内行+ish像……一样,有……的→snobbish势利的,谄上欺下的
wag摇摆,小丑+ish像……一样,有……的→waggish→诙谐的,滑稽的
yellow黄+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.微黄色的
pol擦亮+ish造成……,成……→v.磨光,擦亮;使优美,润饰 n.擦光剂,上光蜡
di分开+mini小+ish造成……,成……→变小,减少
em进入+bell美好+ish造成……,成……→进入美好→装饰
fam饿+ish造成……,成……→v.使饥饿
flour花+ish造成……,成……→v.繁荣,茂盛;挥舞
furb擦亮+ish造成……,成……→v.磨光,刷新
im进入+pover贫困+ish造成……,成……→v.使成赤贫
pol擦亮+ish造成……,成……→v.磨光,擦亮;使优美,润饰 n.擦光剂,上光蜡
vanqu克服+ish造成……,成……→v.征服,击溃

Sentence.sentence: Most notoriously,Oprah's validation of jenny McCarthy's claim that vaccines cause autism(自闭症)has no doubt contributed to much harm through the foolish avoidance of vaccines.

jushi.english: The foolish girl insists on having her own way.
jushi.chinese: 那个愚蠢的女孩子坚持一意孤行。

jushi.english: There were a lot of foolish answers given to the third examination question.
jushi.chinese: 对考卷上的第三题,很多人作了愚蠢的回答。

jushi.english: He could not account for his foolish mistake.
jushi.chinese: 他不能说明他犯愚蠢错误的原因。
